# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> string(x[1], "mm")[2:6], df.dt)
    return df
end
```

This function uses the `map` function to apply a lambda expression to each element in the `dt` column. The lambda expression extracts the year and month from the `DateTime` object using the `[1]` index to get the first element (the year-month tuple), then converts it to a string with the desired format using the `string()` function.
